i cannot be used to evaluate the fabricated LEDs, and the LEDs were further assessed using the TM-30 standard method. In the TM-30 standard, 99 color samples are used to evaluate the light source’s performance. Except for the 1B-Y LED, all other LED PKGs exhibit high color fidelity in TM-30 standard. Figure 5(a,c,e) show color vector graphics (CVGs) and Fig. 5(b,d,f) show the local chroma shifts of the light emitted from the 1B-Y, 1B-GR, and 1B-BYR LEDs (red circles) compared to the reference illuminant (black circles). The arrows in Fig. 5(a,c,e) indicate the shift of the 16 hue bins compared to those of the reference illuminant.
